author: Michael Blazek
text: "Decent pizza
column5: a little watery though.\n\nService was okay but I would have liked the server to come by a little more often. Considering the staffing situation in this country though
column6: I don't fault the establishment on this."

author: Grace .S
text: 'My boyfriend and I came here for dinner since it‚Äôs always packed when we walk past it. We were really impressed by their Tagliatelle al Ragu Bolognese. It wasn‚Äôt overly salty
column5: the pasta was perfectly cooked
column6: and the sauce was *chef‚Äôs kiss*. We also ordered their Margherita pizza which was also great. The only complaint we had was not having enough space on our table as their dishes are large and we had to have our sharing plates taken away.  The location is great
column7: its right by the water front so the view is nice. We will definitely be back to try their other dishes.'

author: catherine hetmanski
text: 'I love this place. Great staff. Great food. Wonderful view of NYC'

author: Henry Estrada
text: 'The pizza was excellent!'

author: Slavica Chavdarsky
text: 'The place has an outside sitting area with a beautiful view of the Sinatra Park and the Hudson River. The tables are small but still it feels comfortable. Food was very good. We ordered some chicken served with pasta and it was delicious and the dish was large. I tried pizza too but for my taste it was a bit too soggy with tomato sauce. Yet
column5: that‚Äôs just my personal preference. Prices for a meal ranged 15-30. Staff were great. Definitely coming back here.'

author: Mina Defee
text:
'Pretty disappointed to be honest.

Reading the Google reviews and looking through some of the other pics on here it looks like this would be an awesome place with great food and a view. It‚Äôs pretty much none of that.

The service was incredibly slow. It took forever to order
column5: forever to get the food
column6:
and forever to pay. It wasn‚Äôt very busy and it didn‚Äôt look understaffed so I don‚Äôt know what the deal was. Did see others get better service so maybe it was just our individual server.

The food was not worth the price. We paid over $20 for the chicken parm and they literally used sliced cheese‚Ä¶ the fruta di mate was pretty good but some of the shells were broken in the spaghetti.

Oh and if you‚Äôre looking for something Sinatra related
column7: you won‚Äôt find it here. The name and a plaque outside are the only things that are related.\n\nIf you‚Äôre looking for a good view
column8: just go to one of the local parks.'

author: vinamra jain
text: 'One of the most authentic Italian restaurant in the city and nearby areas. Staff was very helpful with reservation
column5: ordering and substitutions. We did a professional gathering of about 20 people and everyone liked the food
column6: the drinks and the ambience. Thank you for a wonderful arrangement. Would definitely recommend going there for food
column7: ambience and a wonderful evening.'

author: Supratik Hajare
text: 'Great place to eat and enjoy the NY sky lines. I had Salmon with Pino Noir
column5: the Salmon was nicely cooked with sauce on the plate with veggies. Although their wine selection is not the best out their but is considerable. Give it a go.'

author: STOOL PIGEON
text: "This place is pretty nice with a view-our waiter (Anthony if I'm not mistaken) was really attentive and funny. We were a group of 4 around 2030
column5: food was served fast -my friend got tuna salad I belive which was nothing special tbh. My bro got pork chops and I gotta say that was real good
column6: my other friend only got a cheesecake which was not bad
column7: I got the prosciutto truffle pizza (my first time trying truffles) and I think that was the highlight of the whole night -it was super delicious. Downside is they have no cocktails on site -just wines which we weren't in the mood for"

column6: we enjoyed seating outdoor üòÅü•Çüçª'

text: 'Great food'

text: 'Good food

author: Jael Matos
text: '(Translated by Google) This place is cool. So far one of my favorites in NJ
column5: With an outdoor terrace with a European flair that teleports you to Italy and a wonderful view of the Hudson River and the NY skyline. As for the food it is 5 stars. In the kitchen
column6: the chef must be Italian because each bite tastes like a little piece of Italy
column7: the food is excellent and with first-class products and finally in terms of service ... if you want perfect attention
column8: attentive
column9: friendly and very polite ask for young MATH. He knows well how to treat diners
column10: he gives you your time to order what you want and explains the ingredients of the dish very well in case you have any doubts
column11:
he does not harass you like others who as soon as you have sat down and they are already there. attacking for you to order and order a drink. You will have the time you need to safely order what you want to eat and drink.

(Original)
Este lugar es genial. Hasta ahora unos de mis favoritos en NJ
column12: Con terraza al aire libre con un aire Europeo que te teletransporta   hasta Italia  y una vista maravillosa hacia rio Hudson y el skyline de NY. En cuanto a la comida es de 5 estrellas. En la cocina el chef debe ser Italiano por que cada bocado sabe a un trocito de Italia
column13: la comida es excelente y con productos de primera y para finalizar en cuanto al servicio... si quieres una atenci√≥n perfecta
column15: amable y muy educado pregunta por el joven MATH. El sabe bien como tratar a los comensales
column16: te da tu tiempo para ordenar lo que quieras y te explica muy bien los ingredientes del plato en caso de que tengas alguna duda
column17: no te acosa como otros que no bien te has sentado y ya te est√°n atacando para que ordenes y pidas bebida. Tendr√°s el tiempo que necesitas para ordenar con seguridad lo que deseas comer y beber.'

author: Debra M
text:
'We went to this restaurant to celebrate our daughters birthday.
She has been wanting to eat there for a long time. We got there around 2 place was busy they sat us right away. No one came to our table for a while to see if we wanted drinks. Finally someone came. After brining our drinks which took long we told our waiter we are ready to order but he said he would be right back. Finally we ordered three meals one was a pizza. The waiter asked if we wanted it to come all together we said yes.
We also ordered penne vodka and asked for it to be light on the sauce.
After waiting some time 2 meals came no pizza. The penne vodka was drenched with sauce. Chicken was hard. No Pizza he apologized said pizza never went in. Finally after both meals were done pizza came. I felt so bad for my daughter it was her special day. Bottom line service is horrible
column5: prices are high and food was just ok.'

text: 'Great scenery
column5: fast service
column6: and food was delicious... but too pricey for amount received'

text: '(Translated by Google) Bad service

they should give a customer service course for the staff.

Mal servicio

author: Tata and Bubu
text: 'It was out first visit in this restaurant. I was looking forward to come and eat here since we move here in Hoboken. We tried so many times to come in but everytime we cone its always pack. This time 9/17/21 we finally get to chance to come and eat here since they have no customer and only have 1 table only when we got here. When we got sat down
column5: they asked as for drinks
column6: and asked for Still water
column7: we noticed that the glass was dirty and asked for a new one
column8: the server Jonathan changed up his moos after we asked for that. My boyfriend and i both worked in NYC as Restaurant Manager. After we got out drinks. It took 10minutes for him to come back and said sorry i forgot about you and he will be coming for the complimentary bread. They brought the bread and took out order. I was excited about it and just gave the server a chance. We order Pulpo(octopus) and baked clam. Theyre both great! But when our entree meal came in. Noone even clean up our table yet befor dropping off our entree. We sit in a 2top table. We have to lift our own plates so the busser can put our next meal in our table. After that
column10: our server Jonathan fidnt even check if hows our food. Working in a restaurant
column11: i know that there‚Äôs a 2 bite rule
column12: once a customer took there 2 bites a server should be checking up on the table and make sure the food went well. We just both hope that the food come up good even if our server wasnt that attentivd to us at all.Jonathan never did check on us. Our food was actually not tasteful. The cheese from the chicken parm was old
column13: cause we can taste and see how it look also. My salmon wasnt that great also. We just tried to eat because we didnt want to waste the food
column14: in my end i didnt really ate much because my salmon wasnt that really great for $26 plate. After we ate we were waiting for our server to come and just get the check we waited too long that i have to go inside the restaurant to asked for our check. This is a bad experience. I hope you cAn do something about this issue. This will be our last dine in to this restaurant. We were going to bring our family on Sunday to this restaurant but i had to call another restaurant in the area to make reservation because of this experience. Our bill came to $89 already that we didnt even enjoyed neither service and half of the meal.\n\nThank you for listening.'

text: 'Yummy Italian food right by the waterfront- you get great views of nyc and the water while enjoying a nice meal. The only downside is that since everyone seated outside wants to be close to the water

text: 'Absolutely beautiful view of Manhattan from this location. Like many other reviews said

text: 'Had chicken parm

author: Mel
text: "This place is really just for the view. They had a nice outside seating area and an enclosed area with open 'windows'. The inside was super small and the music was way too loud. I was seated in their inside/outside area with the 'windows'. I was expecting something a little more low key and more of a chill city vibe
column5: but loud pop tunes were ringing out and trying to have a convo was almost impossible.\nI had the penne vodka which was cooked perfectly al dente. For the price point of this place (wasn't too too crazy) I was expecting some bread  before dinner
column6: like any Italian restaurant. This particular person did not ask if bread was wanted nor did they bring any out
column7: but tables sat afterwards all had bread brought out. I asked for a glass of water along with my sangria (which was horrible and $9 a glass). I did not receive my water until the meal was already served and wasn't aware of water options until I overheard the table next to being asked what type of water would they would like. Bottled
column8: sparkling
column9: etc.. I received a room temp glass of water. I will not be going back here."

text: 'Great food with a beautiful view!'

author: Aleks Rich
text: 'The only thing I liked was the view of Manhattan. Calamari was over cooked and improperly prepared
column5: rubbery and bland. I asked for a medium steak and received well done. The worst thing by far was the lasagna. They used b√©chamel sauce for the lasagna
column6: and a so-called ‚Äúbolognese‚Äù that hardly had any meat in it. The pasta itself was over cooked
column7: and the whole thing was soggy in the middle. Service was horrible
column8: took 30 minutes to even order in the first place after our original server had vanished. The place is filthy and the floor is literally sticky
column9: you can feel it clinging to your shoes. I wouldn‚Äôt go back to this place even for free. This is a shame to Italian cuisine.'

text: "The food

I ask for a spoon to eat my fettuccine and he took forever if I had to wait for him and the cheese my food would be cold.... the food was very tasty we tip just because is what we were supposed to not for the service he provided"

author: Cynthia Fernandez
text: 'I came again 8-3-21 giving this place a second chance. The waiter doesn‚Äôt seem happy to serve you. He looks upset when you ask for butter for your bread. He actually told us they don‚Äôt have butter. It‚Äôs an Italian restaurant!!!! I know they have butter. He also says they can not heat the bread. Then he served us sink
column5: lukewarm water with no ice. He looks so bothered when you ask him for stuff. I gave  2 stars because our course was great! We ended up getting two of them. I would love to recommend this place but Fabrizio make sure you don‚Äôt enjoy. I sincerely love it here. It‚Äôs a great view with good food but if the service isn‚Äôt up to par I don‚Äôt need to go back.'

text: 'Excellent pizza right on the waterfront. Really enjoyed the service and the food'

author: Louis Brown
text: "We had a blonde waitress with lots of makeup who didn't seem interested to be there. The food was beautiful and the view was great but the waitress ruined our whole experience. We asked for a cold glass for ice for my beer and she said the dish washer wasn't ready lol she also told us we couldn't make any accommodations to the sauce being on our food meanwhile she could have just put the sauce on the side."

author: diana eskander
text: 'I hate leaving negative reviews but I came with a friend and two kids
column5: since we got in the waitress was kind of rushing us to order. We ordered two pizzas and she didn‚Äôt mention that there was a special that day we only found out when she was telling the customers on the table behind us. Then we ordered two drinks that obviously tasted different from what we ordered. My friend asked the waitress if she got us the right drink because it doesn‚Äôt taste like it. The waitress just said yes it‚Äôs the drink you ordered and left without even asking if we want another drink instead or if there is a problem with the drink. Maybe it was the right drink but that didn‚Äôt taste good. We honestly felt like she was not treating us properly especially that she was not giving other customers the same treatment. Honestly the three stars are for the pizza it was delicious.'

author: William Santiago
text: 'Great food and great customer experience. We will definitely be coming back.'

author: Ashley Yang
text: "Not sure if this place is still operating but we arrived a little before 8pm on a Monday. Their website says they are open mon-thurs from 12pm to 10 pm but when we got there the place looked completely abandoned with some tables half cleared of silverware. Some other tables had cups set out even and some others didn't. Some tables even had chairs stacked on the table while others didn't. Looked completely abandoned honestly. The Google hours were wrong as well.\n\nWe tried calling as well with no one answering. Be sure to call and see if they are open before going."

column5: add a few more sets of hands in the busy season! Food was great
column6: reasonably priced and presented well. Pizza was great and the atmosphere is awesome.'

column6: welcomed

text: 'Wow

author: Davide Siciliano
text: "This is a great authentic Italian restaurant
column5: right on the Hudson River
column6: across from Manhattan. In fact
column7: you can see the NYC Skyline while dining here. If you didn't know it is named after Ol' Blue Eyes
column8: who happened to be from Hoboken
column9: you would probably think the name of this eatery doesn't sound very Italian. But Frank was a true goombah and was proud of his Italian heritage. My lady friend and I shared a delectable margherita pizza. There is one grumpy young waitress here
column10: though. That is why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5. Fortunately
column11: our waiter was very hospitable and respectful."

column5: good service
column6: the view and atmosphere are decent too. I liked the place
column7: but I think the food is a bit overpriced.'

text: 'Best Italian pizza in Hoboken. Amazing location'

author: Nikiya Mone
text: "We came during lunch and ordered from the lunch menu
column5: and everyone thoroughly enjoyed their food! I had the chicken parm with the house salad
column6: the salad was great and the chicken parm was great! My mgr had the arugula salad with chicken and it was delicious! The eggplant parm was great with the cauliflower soup! The atmosphere is great
column7: the wait staff are great and attentive! I'd surely recommend this place to everyone!"

text: 'Very good food at acceptable prices.'

text: 'So expensive!!!'

author: Roberto Angarano
text: "(Translated by Google) I saw you on TV and I have to make my compliments good
column5: it's good to know that there are Italians like you who value our country abroad. Beautiful restaurant
column6:
if one day I will come in the U.S. I will definitely come to visit you. Good life.

author: Kathleen O'Hara
text: 'Food was good
column5: views were great
column6: but the lack of ventilation in the outdoor tent was brutal. Need to go back on a cooler night and reevaluate.'
